intro: Bossekia parviflora, commonly known as the dwarf bossekia, is a small flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is often cultivated in rock gardens and xeriscapes.
